playn.core.gl
Interface GLBuffer

All Known Subinterfaces:
GLBuffer.Float, GLBuffer.Short
All Known Implementing Classes:
GL20Buffer, GL20Buffer.FloatImpl, GL20Buffer.ShortImpl
public interface GLBuffer

An abstraction over bulk buffers for use with GLShader and GLProgram.

Nested Class Summary
static interface GLBuffer.Float
          A buffer of 32-bit floats.
static interface GLBuffer.Short
          A buffer of 16-bit unsigned integers.
 
Method Summary
 void bind(int target)
          Issues the GL call to bind this buffer.
 int byteSize()
          The size of the data in this buffer, in bytes.
 int capacity()
          Returns the total capacity of this buffer (number of floats, shorts, etc.
 void destroy()
          Releases any GL resources used by this buffer.
 void expand(int capacity)
          Expands the buffer to accommodate the specified new capacity.
 int position()
          Returns the current position of the buffer pointer (which is also the number of elements currently occupied in the buffer).
 int send(int target, int usage)
          Sends this buffer's data to GL.
 void skip(int count)
          Advances the position of this buffer without writing any data to it.
 

Method Detail

capacity

int capacity()
Returns the total capacity of this buffer (number of floats, shorts, etc. it can hold).

position

int position()
Returns the current position of the buffer pointer (which is also the number of elements currently occupied in the buffer).

byteSize

int byteSize()
The size of the data in this buffer, in bytes.

skip

void skip(int count)
Advances the position of this buffer without writing any data to it.

expand

void expand(int capacity)
Expands the buffer to accommodate the specified new capacity.

bind

void bind(int target)
Issues the GL call to bind this buffer.

send

int send(int target,
         int usage)
Sends this buffer's data to GL. A call to bind(int) must precede this call. This resets the buffer offset to zero and prepares the buffer for the accumulation of new elements.

Returns:
the number of elements in the buffer at the time it was bound.

destroy

void destroy()
Releases any GL resources used by this buffer. The buffer may not be used subsequently.
